title: SirJohnVonSlotty
author: SirJohnVonSlotty
created_time: January 03, 2023, 02:44:11 PMLast edit: June 30, 2023, 11:32:39 AM by SirJohnVonSlotty
content: 4th of May 2023 Update: Hey guys! Happy to announce that we entered the third phase of our project, and are on the right way of becoming a community driven crypto casino. In November 2022 we re-launched the brand under new management, where we focused on a more secure, robust and licensed gambling experience. Our goal was to establish our name within the crypto community, partner up with several well-known affiliates, and overall close the gap between unregulated and fully licensed online crypto gambling. Our friends at BTCGosu.com helped us a lot here, there were one of our first contacts here on BitcoinTalk, and I truly believe that we wouldn't be here without their help   In January 2023 we introduced our brand to you guys, the BitcoinTalk.org community. We launched several projects, including a crypto casino review thread, design competitions and the first version of this ANN thread, that today gets a fresh new look thanks to Jayce! With this approach, we let our players voice their opinion about our brand publicly, and work towards improving whatever is in our power to do so.In February 2023 we reached our first Affiliate milestones – with 100 closed affiliate deals promoting Coinslotty around the online crypto landscape. Through a gifting campaign, we celebrated that achievement with various leaders from the industry, including BTCGosu, Cryptorunner, Bitcoinist and many more. 5,000 hand-made golden chocolate coins were distributed to each of our partners, together with custom-branded gadgets  And today, on May the 4th, we launched the third iteration of the product, a rebranded and improved experience that now flies new colours, features a new font, higher bonuses and an attractive VIP program. Added to this, we also increased our offerings and partnered up with even more online casino software providers.I hope you guys will have fun, and if you want to learn more about our brand I left a few links below  #1. November Re-Launch Announcement on Yahoo Finance#2. Coinslotty.com Review on BTCGosu.com#3. February Affiliate Milestone Announcement on  CryptoNews.com #4. Curacao License Validator  can be found here#5. Our first BitcoinTalk.com Review Campaign can be found here. #6. The Signature Design Contest can be found here #7. The ANN Design Contest  is here  #8. Our Signature Campaign Thread is managed by Cro2, and can be found  under this link

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Welcome to the forum coinslotty, I took a quick glance at the website and it looks pretty clean, though not like it's really unique from other Casinos, but it looks pretty decent..Also signing up seem easy and fast, since it does not require me filling a long form like am applying for kyc verification  ,Just a tab for email address, another tab under for password, and a last tab for username, that's pretty awesome.I will like to know what the minimum deposit amount is that is required to access the welcome bonus,? and seems there is a limit, as I can see upto $250, and $100 respectively

comments.author: Ojima-ojo
comments.body: Welcome to bitcointalk forum, I just visited your website and it looks good even though I did not make any attempt to register an account on the casino.I was able to go through some of the casino's basic features and I can say to a great extent that your team know what their up against, and you already have a professional site.I did not check much but let's see what the review of other members of the forum will be, but all the same welcome to bitcountalk.

comments.author: bitcampaign
comments.body: welcome to this forum Coinslotty, I just accessed your website using the browser on my phone, it's easy enough to access it's interesting enough for me, but I still want to see more on your website later, maybe there are games that make me interested in playing there moreover there is an interesting welcome bonus as well

comments.body: Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on January 03, 2023, 03:02:16 PMWelcome to the forum coinslotty, I took a quick glance at the website and it looks pretty clean, though not like it's really unique from other Casinos, but it looks pretty decent..Also signing up seem easy and fast, since it does not require me filling a long form like am applying for kyc verification  ,Just a tab for email address, another tab under for password, and a last tab for username, that's pretty awesome.I will like to know what the minimum deposit amount is that is required to access the welcome bonus,? and seems there is a limit, as I can see upto $250, and $100 respectively Thank you for the feedback! I tried to keep the minimum deposit for the BTCGosu welcome offer as low as I could, and right now it's set to 30 USD  You can see all of the details it on their welcome page under this link here: https://coinslottymedia.com/a9664d25f

comments.author: macson
comments.body: hi OP, congrats on launching your gambling site's ANN thread in this forum, i've tried visiting your site and wow, that's really fast, i haven't experienced any lag.  i am also interested in seeing your promotional links https://www.coinslotty.com/bonuses, good luck with CoinSlotty.com marketing plans.

comments.author: notblox1
comments.body: Coinslotty I wish you a warm welcome to bitcointalk forum and thank you for special bonus offer.I like design you are using for your website and I would like to know if there are any withdrawal fees for getting Bitcoin to my own wallet?Few other casinos are my daily drivers and I need something really special to get me signed up to use some new gambling website, and no kyc up to 2 BTC is great to hear.

comments.author: virasog
comments.body: Quote from: SirJohnVonSlotty on January 03, 2023, 03:23:05 PMQuote from: Fivestar4everMVP on January 03, 2023, 03:02:16 PMWelcome to the forum coinslotty, I took a quick glance at the website and it looks pretty clean, though not like it's really unique from other Casinos, but it looks pretty decent..Also signing up seem easy and fast, since it does not require me filling a long form like am applying for kyc verification  ,Just a tab for email address, another tab under for password, and a last tab for username, that's pretty awesome.I will like to know what the minimum deposit amount is that is required to access the welcome bonus,? and seems there is a limit, as I can see upto $250, and $100 respectively Thank you for the feedback! I tried to keep the minimum deposit for the BTCGosu welcome offer as low as I could, and right now it's set to 30 USD  You can see all of the details it on their welcome page under this link here: https://coinslottymedia.com/a9664d25fI will surely check this site and i am interested to know about this 2 BTC without KYC feature of CoinSlotty. Does it means that if i have, let suppose less than 2 bitcoin in my account and i do not withdraw 2 bitcoin, i can play without KYC ?At which time do i have to do the KYC, when the cumulative withdraw reaches 2 bitcoins ? or it is just that we can't withdraw 2 bitcoin at a single time without KYC ?

comments.author: Ojima-ojo
comments.body: Quote from: virasog on January 03, 2023, 08:01:12 PMI will surely check this site and i am interested to know about this 2 BTC without KYC feature of CoinSlotty. Does it means that if i have, let suppose less than 2 bitcoin in my account and i do not withdraw 2 bitcoin, i can play without KYC ?At which time do i have to do the KYC, when the cumulative withdraw reaches 2 bitcoins ? or it is just that we can't withdraw 2 bitcoin at a single time without KYC ?What that supposedly means is that 2 BTC is the maximum withdrawal without KYC, which to me is big enough considering the possibility of bitcoin gaining a high price which automatically will translate into a high DCA withdrawal amount.e.g if Bitcoin gains a $100,000 price that means a player in the casino could withdraw up to $200,0000 without being asked for KYC verifications.Think this is preferable enough because some other casinos only have a maximum of $1000 and any amount higher than $1000 will be subject to go through KYC verification before the withdrawal will be processed.

comments.author: Bitinity
comments.body: Quote from: notblox1 on January 03, 2023, 07:48:00 PMCoinslotty I wish you a warm welcome to bitcointalk forum and thank you for special bonus offer.I like design you are using for your website and I would like to know if there are any withdrawal fees for getting Bitcoin to my own wallet?Few other casinos are my daily drivers and I need something really special to get me signed up to use some new gambling website, and no kyc up to 2 BTC is great to hear.Based on their terms, I found something different about the limit for the KYC. On their terms page, they stated that they limit is 1BTC as quoted below: Quote12.6 The casino reserves the right to carry out additional verification procedures for any payout exceeding the equivalent of 1 Bitcoin, and further reserves the right to carry out such verification procedures in case of lower payouts. Players who wish to recover funds held in a closed, locked or excluded account, are advised to contact Customer SupportAlthough 1btc is still big enough for recreational gambler, but it is a big difference with what they claim here that KYC will start at 2btc. So which one is the valid information? Or maybe 2btc limit is like a special condition for bitcointalk members only? If it is, how they will know that someone come from bitcointalk?

comments.author: Daltonik
comments.body: Welcome to the forum. It's nice to see an online casino that is not overloaded with additional requirements for players, such as blocking when using a VPN, this will save many from sudden blockages and misunderstandings, and I think the mandatory KYC when exceeding the 1BTC limit will be attractive for small players.

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: First of all, I wish to personally welcome the "CoinSlotty" casino to the bitcointalk forum, it's a pleasure having yours to be among the very first to be launched this new year 2023. I just glanced through the casino and it has a very good interface, but one I will love to suggest to help boost your exposure on the forum is considering running a signature or avatar campaign like many other successful casinos on the forum. So I'm wishing you the best and a Happy New Year

comments.body: welcome to the forum and hopefully whatever you want to achieve success your platform is well done here and has a good reputation to continue to develop your gambling project.maybe you'll consider the suggestions of some other members like @CryptoHeadlineNews. It would be better and faster to build a reputation of trust in the members you are here with if you would consider the opportunity to promote through a signature campaign here.and I have tried to open your site using my mobile and computer, both work fine and very friendly CoinSlotty site. it looks no less interesting than other platforms.hopefully you will build a great community here.

comments.author: Broadanbig
comments.body: Welcome onboard this platform. As I see you have a good partnership deal with reputable members on this platform. If I may ask do you have location restrictions? do you have kyc or aml as one of your compulsory registration policy? Please do well to furnish us with this information as to know. To further build your reputation and presence amongst members and prospective participants of your platform, I will also suggest just as it has already been suggested earlier before now that you seek a good signature campaign manager to run a signature campaign for your casino which would help boast your presence here. It would also build your reputation as well since you already have partners with good reputation here. All these added together will give you a good edge to showcase what you offer.

comments.author: Cointxz
comments.body: For starter, You should rescale your image to a more visible size and also make the separated text smaller because your announcement image needs to be zoom in order to read the content since you over size the additional text above and below. Much better if you limit to summary the content of your image so that you can add the above additional text in the image format for a better aesthetic of your thread.Embed your url on your image so that players can go to your website by clicking your image. Use the code below.Code:[center][url= https://www.coinslotty.com/][img]https://i.ibb.co/6th1S5j/r0Ha5-Q.jpg[/img][/url][/center]The games is the typical offered so I will not gonna comment on it. I’m interested to know the details of the “RCP” tokens that use to buy on the shop. Where can I read info about it because it’s not easily visible on the casino.

comments.author: SirJohnVonSlotty
comments.body: Quote from: Bitinity on January 04, 2023, 05:14:20 AMQuote from: notblox1 on January 03, 2023, 07:48:00 PMCoinslotty I wish you a warm welcome to bitcointalk forum and thank you for special bonus offer.I like design you are using for your website and I would like to know if there are any withdrawal fees for getting Bitcoin to my own wallet?Few other casinos are my daily drivers and I need something really special to get me signed up to use some new gambling website, and no kyc up to 2 BTC is great to hear.Based on their terms, I found something different about the limit for the KYC. On their terms page, they stated that they limit is 1BTC as quoted below: Quote12.6 The casino reserves the right to carry out additional verification procedures for any payout exceeding the equivalent of 1 Bitcoin, and further reserves the right to carry out such verification procedures in case of lower payouts. Players who wish to recover funds held in a closed, locked or excluded account, are advised to contact Customer SupportAlthough 1btc is still big enough for recreational gambler, but it is a big difference with what they claim here that KYC will start at 2btc. So which one is the valid information? Or maybe 2btc limit is like a special condition for bitcointalk members only? If it is, how they will know that someone come from bitcointalk? Ah, no, it's 2 BTC! Sorry about that  I have updated the terms in the backend before the launch, but seems like the devs are still pushing it out on the front end. Holiday season got the best out of us - but I'll make sure to have the terms of use reflect this by the end of the week  How does the KYC 2 BTC limit work? There's no KYC if your personal account has had winnings or deposits below 2 BTC (or any other currency equivalent), as soon as your account reaches that lifetime 2 BTC threshold (be it by your deposits or with winnings) a KYC is triggered. Since we are a licensed casino, we have to have this in place for the regulations, but luckily we managed to bump it up from 0.5 BTC to 2 BTC  Quote from: Coin_trader on January 04, 2023, 08:55:30 AMFor starter, You should rescale your image to a more visible size and also make the separated text smaller because your announcement image needs to be zoom in order to read the content since you over size the additional text above and below. Much better if you limit to summary the content of your image so that you can add the above additional text in the image format for a better aesthetic of your thread.Embed your url on your image so that players can go to your website by clicking your image. Use the code below.Code:[center][url= https://www.coinslotty.com/][img]https://i.ibb.co/6th1S5j/r0Ha5-Q.jpg[/img][/url][/center]The games is the typical offered so I will not gonna comment on it. I’m interested to know the details of the “RCP” tokens that use to buy on the shop. Where can I read info about it because it’s not easily visible on the casino.Thank you so much! It's been a while since I was an active forum member, so help is appreciated  I've requested an updated infographic, if you have any more ideas let me know  How do the RCP tokens work? With each bet of 20 USDT or equivalent you get 1 RCP token, the same points are accumulating in your account. Once you have enough, you can redeem any of the subscriptions or devices

comments.author: Strongkored
comments.body: Welcome to the forum coinslotty, it looks like you are well prepared for the launch of your casino and were able to collaborate with one of the well-known gambling review websites on this forum, namely btcgosu and got a pretty good rating, this good rating giving confidence to members of this forum to try to play at your casino.

comments.author: Jody.Drummer
comments.body: Welcome and congrats on your trying to get off to a good start on the casino offerings in this forum. Although there are still shortcomings regarding delivery, especially in dropping ANN threads which are relatively rudimentary. But we understand that and you can fix it or hire someone who is professional to do it.I'll focus on the simple things about this casino:1. The initial display for registering is clearly very dark and I think it should be a little considered to provide several colored (shapes) that separate between sub emails, sub passwords, etc. Look at the screenshot below.2. Sub, after entering what type of crypto will be deposited, there is an empty column that really doesn't need to be added. Moreover, there is no information on what should I fill in.3. In the promotion section I quite like it because there are so many bonus points such as Cashback and the unique daily promotion bonus. Although I need more to know, maybe the VIP members must be in for a lot of surprises.4. There are quite a lot of games available and I think you can say they have been fulfilled.5. Maybe I need a deposit to know more about the extent of this casino because I need something different from the others. Even if you tell me what are the advantages if you play at Coinslotty.
